feed.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - Mobile App Manual
feed.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

items.title: Breaking: Homeland Security suspends travel ban
items.description: A federal judge in Washington State granted a temporary restraining order Friday night that the state's attorney general said immediately halted President Donald Trump's immigration executive order effective nationwide.<div class=
items.content: A federal judge in Washington State granted a temporary restraining order Friday night that the state's attorney general said immediately halted President Donald Trump's immigration executive order effective nationwide.<div class=

items.title: Trump slams judge's halt of travel ban
items.description: President Donald Trump on Saturday again attacked a sitting federal judge whose decision he disliked, criticizing Judge James Robart, a George W. Bush appointee who temporarily stopped his controversial travel ban Friday night.<div class=
items.content: President Donald Trump on Saturday again attacked a sitting federal judge whose decision he disliked, criticizing Judge James Robart, a George W. Bush appointee who temporarily stopped his controversial travel ban Friday night.<div class=

items.title: Trump rips federal judge in tweet
items.description: CNN's Michael Smerconish sounds off on President Donald Trump's tweet that rips federal judge James L. Robart for halting immigration travel ban.<div class=
items.content: CNN's Michael Smerconish sounds off on President Donald Trump's tweet that rips federal judge James L. Robart for halting immigration travel ban.<div class=

items.title: Meet the judge who blocked Trump's travel ban
items.description: The White House is gearing up to fight a federal judge's nationwide halt of President Donald Trump's immigration order.<div class=
items.content: The White House is gearing up to fight a federal judge's nationwide halt of President Donald Trump's immigration order.<div class=

items.title: Airlines allow barred passengers after judge blocks ban
items.description: Many international airlines are allowing nationals of seven Muslim-majority countries hit with President Donald Trump's travel ban to board US-bound flights after a federal judge on Friday blocked the controversial ban nationwide.<div class=
items.content: Many international airlines are allowing nationals of seven Muslim-majority countries hit with President Donald Trump's travel ban to board US-bound flights after a federal judge on Friday blocked the controversial ban nationwide.<div class=

items.title: Baby caught in travel ban can head to US for surgery
items.description: An Iranian infant with a heart defect is entangled in President Trump's immigration ban -- and her extended family in Oregon is on an urgent mission to get her to the US for critical surgery.<div class=
items.content: An Iranian infant with a heart defect is entangled in President Trump's immigration ban -- and her extended family in Oregon is on an urgent mission to get her to the US for critical surgery.<div class=

items.title: Burned toddler's future waits on Trump's ban
items.description: The parents of an Iraqi toddler undergoing treatment for severe facial burns in the US are concerned they will be unable to travel to join their son as the result of President Trump's travel ban. Dr. Sanjay Gupta reports.<div class=
items.content: The parents of an Iraqi toddler undergoing treatment for severe facial burns in the US are concerned they will be unable to travel to join their son as the result of President Trump's travel ban. Dr. Sanjay Gupta reports.<div class=

items.title: Mattis: Iran is world's 'biggest state sponsor of terrorism'
items.description: US Defense Secretary James Mattis said Iran was
making his first comments on the country a day after the Trump administration imposed fresh sanctions over a ballistic missile test.<div class=
items.content: US Defense Secretary James Mattis said Iran was
making his first comments on the country a day after the Trump administration imposed fresh sanctions over a ballistic missile test.<div class=

items.title: CNN/ORC poll: Majority oppose Trump's travel ban
items.description: Most Americans oppose the travel restrictions put in place by President Donald Trump's executive order last week, a new CNN/ORC poll has found.<div class=
items.content: Most Americans oppose the travel restrictions put in place by President Donald Trump's executive order last week, a new CNN/ORC poll has found.<div class=

items.title: Trump inspires grassroots protest movement
items.description: CNN's Brian Todd reports on the surge of anti-Trump protests across the United States.<div class=
items.content: CNN's Brian Todd reports on the surge of anti-Trump protests across the United States.<div class=

items.title: Eminem unleashes on Trump
items.description: Eminem truly is not afraid to take a stand.<div class=
items.content: Eminem truly is not afraid to take a stand.<div class=

items.title: Trump has highest disapproval rating for a new president
items.description: It's been two weeks since Donald Trump's inauguration, and the new President's work so far hasn't impressed the American people.<div class=
items.content: It's been two weeks since Donald Trump's inauguration, and the new President's work so far hasn't impressed the American people.<div class=

items.title: Presidential signatures: How does Trump stand up?
items.description: Shortly after President Donald Trump took the oath of office, he went back inside the Capitol and did one of the main things presidents do: he signed a bunch of official papers while less powerful people stood around and smiled.<div class=
items.content: Shortly after President Donald Trump took the oath of office, he went back inside the Capitol and did one of the main things presidents do: he signed a bunch of official papers while less powerful people stood around and smiled.<div class=

items.title: See CNN anchor's emotional sendoff
items.description: Carol Costello gets emotional as CNN plays a farewell video during her final broadcast. Costello is leaving CNN and moving to Los Angeles to join HLN.<div class=
items.content: Carol Costello gets emotional as CNN plays a farewell video during her final broadcast. Costello is leaving CNN and moving to Los Angeles to join HLN.<div class=

items.title: Report: Trump still tied to his businesses
items.description: New York Times investigative reporter Eric Lipton discusses newly discovered records that show Trump is still tied to his business empire.<div class=
items.content: New York Times investigative reporter Eric Lipton discusses newly discovered records that show Trump is still tied to his business empire.<div class=

items.title: Cost of F-35 cut
items.description: Defense giant Lockheed Martin has agreed to sell 90 new F-35 fighter jets to the US Defense Department for $8.5 billion -- a deal that amounts to more than $700 million in savings over the last batch of aircraft delivered.<div class=
items.content: Defense giant Lockheed Martin has agreed to sell 90 new F-35 fighter jets to the US Defense Department for $8.5 billion -- a deal that amounts to more than $700 million in savings over the last batch of aircraft delivered.<div class=

items.title: Hill Republicans revolt over Trump's wall
items.description: President Donald Trump's plan to build a wall on the border with Mexico is facing a major problem: A wall of resistance from his own party.<div class=
items.content: President Donald Trump's plan to build a wall on the border with Mexico is facing a major problem: A wall of resistance from his own party.<div class=

items.title: Viola withdraws from Secretary of Army nomination
items.description: President Donald Trump's nominee for secretary of the Army, Vincent Viola, is withdrawing, citing business ties.<div class=
items.content: President Donald Trump's nominee for secretary of the Army, Vincent Viola, is withdrawing, citing business ties.<div class=

items.title: Controversial education pick inches toward confirmation
items.description: The Senate met at an odd hour early in the morning and voted to advance education secretary nominee Betsy DeVos to a final confirmation vote.<div class=
items.content: The Senate met at an odd hour early in the morning and voted to advance education secretary nominee Betsy DeVos to a final confirmation vote.<div class=

items.title: Flu spreads across 40 states
items.description: Health officials across the United States are still urging people to get their flu vaccines as the virus continues to spread in 40 states and Puerto Rico and has been associated with 15 pediatric deaths, seven of them reported in the week ending January 28.<div class=
items.content: Health officials across the United States are still urging people to get their flu vaccines as the virus continues to spread in 40 states and Puerto Rico and has been associated with 15 pediatric deaths, seven of them reported in the week ending January 28.<div class=
